intro: Racosperma cheelii, commonly known as the Cheel's acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are bipinnate, and it produces yellow flowers arranged in cylindrical inflorescences. Racosperma cheelii is adapted to dry environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
